channel.description: Recent content in pro on Nebrass Homepage

item.title: Projects ideas for software engineering students ğŸ’¡
item.description: During many career talks I attended, I noticed that some questions come back every time: " As a final year student, how can I get an internship? What can I mention in my CV to make it attractive? " ğŸ¤” The problem is that always we start being concerned about internships too late, only some weeks before starting the search operation ğŸ’£ Although, finding a good internship needs to be prepared many months before…

item.title: "Playing with Java Microservices with Quarkus and Kubernetes" is available in Early Access
item.description: Today is the big day ğŸ¥³ğŸ¥³ My third book “Playing with Java Microservices with Quarkus and Kubernetes” is available in Early Access ğŸ‰ğŸŠğŸˆâœ¨ Book cover I started working on the book starting from June ğŸ˜Â I spent nearly 5 months presenting the most interesting and powerful features of the Quarkus Framework. When I started the Proof-of-concept, I didn’t have the idea of writing a book on Quarkus, I was just discovering.

item.title: Just finished the first four chapters..
item.description: Today, I will not be sharing a tutorial or a review, I will share with you my new book news ! ğŸ¥³ I just finished typing the fourth chapter.Â These four chapters belong to the first part of the story: the MoNoLITHiC dedicated part ğŸ¤ª .. What’s newÂ ? In my previous book “Playing with Java Microservices on Kubernetes and OpenShift” there was a Docker-only chapter in the middle of the book.

item.title: Celebrating my 30th birthday & my 1st year in Microsoft
item.description: Today is my birthday and what a wonderful day to celebrate my life, but not only. Today I celebrate my first year in Microsoft, one of the most wonderful years in my career.. a year plenty of great new people, amazing challenges, wellness and happiness. ğŸ‰ğŸŠ When I started working for Microsoft last year, I was the Java developer joining the .Net Gurus town.Â It was a very exceptional situation for my Java friends, because since I started working in 2012, I was always dealing with the open source world, and Microsoft at that time wasn’t in the same planet as us.

item.title: Workshop Report: ENSI â€“ January 2020
item.description: The workshop “Playing with Java Microservices on Kubernetes” was held from 02/01 to 04/01 - 2020, at the National School of Computer Sciences, in Manouba, Tunisia. Great gift ğŸ˜ The workshop was done on 21 Hours of training about Java, Spring Boot, DDD, Docker, Kubernetes, Cloud Patterns, Azure AKS & Functionsâ€¦ Some Github repositories used in the sessions: Monolith Example Microservices Examples Speaker Deck The event was sponsored byÂ MicrosoftÂ ğŸ˜ğŸ¤©ğŸ¥³ !

item.title: Playing with Java Microservices on Kubernetes - ENSI 2020
item.description: I will be in the National School of Computing Sciences of Tunisia (ENSI Tunisia), from the 2nd to 4th January 2020, to animate a 20 Hours workshop, about Microservices in Java and how to deploy them as Docker Containers to Kubernetes. The event is organized by Mrs Rim Drira. The workshop content: Part 1: The Monolithics Era Part 2: Coding the monolith Part 3: Microservices Era Part 4: Applying DDD to the code Part 5: Meeting & Implementing the Âµservices concerns and patterns Part 6: Building the standalone Âµservices Part 7: Packaging Âµservices in containers Part 8: Falling in ğŸ¥° with container orchestrator: KUBERNETES ğŸ˜ Part 9: Applying the Kubernetes Style Part 10: Meeting Azure â˜ï¸ Part X: What â€™s next ?

item.title: Playing with CQRS and Event Sourcing in Spring Boot and Axon
item.description: The Microservices Architecture World, we can meet many concepts and patterns, like the Centralized Configuration, Circuit Breaker, Service Registry and Discovery, etc.. Two of these patterns are the CQRS and the Event Sourcing patterns, coming from the Domain Driven Design planet ğŸŒ In the most of the use-cases, these two patterns are sold together ğŸ˜ in this new tutorial, we will discover what does each one ? why they are usually used together ?

item.title: Celebrating the 100 points in the Google Lighthouse Reports
item.description: In this post, I will share with you my experience starting from a disaster that occurred to my blog â˜ ï¸ğŸ˜¢ğŸ˜­ until reaching the 100/100 performance score and get all Audits Validation Badges on Google Lighthouse ğŸ†ğŸ¥‡ğŸ‰ğŸŠğŸˆğŸ’¯/ğŸ’¯ğŸ¥³ October 10th, I was writing a new post in my blog, in one of the previews, the site kept loading without giving any response. ğŸ˜±ğŸ˜«ğŸ˜°ğŸ˜“ğŸ˜³ğŸ¥µ My blog is based on the Wordpress CMS and hosted in an Ubuntu VPS by OVH since August 28th, 2015.

item.title: Playing with Java in Azure Functions - New Release
item.description: In one of the previous posts, I introduced the Azure Functions Java. I felt that I need to write a dedicated tutorial to this great Azure Serverless service ğŸ˜ In this post, I will be covering many concepts in deep: TriggersÂ andÂ bindings Events and messaging Deployments & Consumptions Monitoring Generating the hello-world project We will scaffold a Java-based Azure Function project using Maven Archetypes, using this command:

item.title: Trip Report: Netherlands Trip - October 2019
item.description: I was for a week in Amsterdam, Netherlands, to attend the Microsoft OpenHack about the Migrating Workloads to Azure from the 14th to the 18th of October. It’s not my first visit to Amsterdam, and like every time, it was an amazing visit ğŸ¥³ Like every trip, here is a small Flickr album: https://www.flickr.com/photos/nebrass78/albums/72157711449636051

item.title: Thank you JetBrains for the complimentary subscription ! ğŸ¤©
item.description: I would like to thank JetBrains for offering me the complimentary JetBrains All Products Pack subscription as part of the JetBrains Developer Recognition Program ğŸ¤© Say hello to my IntelliJ IDEA Ultimate

item.title: Playing with Azure Monitor services and Spring Boot
item.description: In enterprise application, performance is major requirement of success. Especially for applications where slowness will have a direct detrimental impact on business productivity, profits and even the brand itself, like trading platforms and e-commerces. If a trading platform loads slowly or experiences errors, it will translate into loss of business, and losses can be extremely high, and the customer might end up switching to another competitor. In this context comes the Application Performance ManagementÂ (APM).

item.title: Playing with OpenShift 4 locally
item.description: January 2018, Red Hat acquired CoreOS for 250 million dollars ğŸ¤©. CoreOS was one of the leading companies of Linux & Containers market with their wide offer of products: CoreOS Tectonic: container application platform based on Kubernetes. CoreOS Container Linux: lightweight Linux distribution designed to run containerized applications. CoreOS Operators Framework: an open source toolkit designed to manage Kubernetes native applications. CoreOS Quay: a container registry for building, storing, and distributing your private containers.

item.title: London Trip - June 2019
item.description: I attended the Microsoft OpenHack Kafka from the 3rd to the 5th of June in London. I had some free time to do a small visit to the City.Â As always, my Lumix G7 was travelling with me ğŸ˜† The first day, when I just arrived, I wanted to visit the Big Ben and the Palace of Westminster. Unfortunately, the Big Ben is under maintenance.Â I couldn’t see it ğŸ˜­ğŸ˜­ But, I could the chance to shoot the ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸ US Marine One !

item.title: Big up! My book is FREE now !!
item.description: To celebrate the Groundbreaker Award and Oracle Code New York, my book “Playing with Java Microservices on Kubernetes and OpenShift” will be FREE forever ! This is a gift is for the community that voted for me and helped me to achieve this great award ! ğŸ¤© The book is available on the Leanpub website: Thank you so much for voting for me !! ğŸ¥³

item.title: Officially: I'm an Oracle Groundbreaker ğŸ¤©ğŸ¥³
item.description: I’m thrilledâš¡ to announce that I’m one of the four winners of the Oracle Groundbreaker Awards for this year ğŸ¤© https://twitter.com/OracleDevs/status/1129159643148611584 This is one of the happiest moments of my life ğŸ¥° https://twitter.com/OracleDevs/status/1129842891009007616 Here is the video of the ceremony ğŸ¤©ğŸ˜ğŸ¥° Thank you for all those who believed and voted for me !! Thank you for your support that made me win !!

item.title: Discovering Machine Learning ?!
item.description: Some days ago, I got an idea to make a personal project about “Connected Devices”. This idea led me to discover some Artificial Intelligence and especially Machine Learning. The first thing that I did: I started seeking for a good course in many websites: edx, coursera and udemy.. These are the most popular sites of elearning that I am usually referencing to when I want to attack new technology or any CS field.

item.title: I'm a finalist in the Oracle Groundbreaker Awards !
item.description: Thursday March 28th, 2019,Â night, I was flying from Paris to Tunis.Â When I landed and the network came back, I got a mysterious Twitter notification: I am tagged in a tweet published by @OracleDevs : I was extremely happy in a way that I thought maybe I was dreaming. The plane landed nearly 00:30, I was tired, so I was convinced maybe a DayDream, or Early Night Dream, as it was midnight !

item.title: New book update #1
item.description: I just updated my book Â« Playing with Java Microservices with Kubernetes and OpenShift Â» ğŸ˜ƒ The release changelog: Fixed some typos ğŸ™ˆ I just finished writing the Chapter 14: Getting started with OpenShift ğŸ‘Œ I started writing the Chapter 15: The OpenShift style ğŸ¶ I started working on Istio Tutorial that will be the first bonus chapter in the book âš¡ï¸âš¡ï¸ I will be covering more and more subjects soon ğŸ˜

item.title: Workshop Report: ENSI â€“ November 2018
item.description: The workshop “Playing with Java Microservices on Kubernetes” was held from 19/11 to 24/11, at the National School of Computer Sciences, in Mannouba, Tunisia. The workshop was done on 18 Hours of training about Java, Spring Boot, DDD, Docker, Kubernetes, Cloud Patterns, CI/CD… Some Github repositories used in the sessions: Monolith Example Microservices Examples We got even a special guest, my techno-mate Houssem Dellai, the great Microsoft MVP, that presented, thru a 3 Hours session, Docker & Kubernetes and the CI/CD lifecycles with a great demo of Azure DevOps for the students of ENSI Tunisia.

item.title: Meetup Report: Architecture in the Cloud Era
item.description: We organized, at Onepoint, our first Architecture Meetup, the 19th of July, in our beautiful headquarters in TrocadÃ©ro, Paris. Our first edition’s guest: Aymen El Amri : the founder of eralabs a consulting and training company and, a community hub. He help companies build and learn how to build modern and cloud native applications. He’s written tech books like Painless Docker and founded online communities like DevOpsLinks and Kaptain.

item.title: onepoint.. my new beginning..
item.description: Here we go ! Today, I start workingÂ as Technical Leader for OnePoint Group, the Leader in Digital Transformation in France & Europe. Onepoint? Founded on 2002 More than 2200 Employees 36 years old as average age 13 offices worldwide Communities & Brainstorming Driven Company What will I be doing? I will be a member of the Architecture Community, to help architects deploy their solutions in Java. I will be also a member of the Banking, Finance & Insurance Community member.

item.title: Good bye Davidson Consulting!
item.description: Today marks my last day at Davidson Consulting, after a great experience of nearly three years. I have enjoyed working for Davidson, even I was excited on some projects. Many great achievements: Successful project realization for EthiKonsulting Successful contract with Airbus Defense & Space Successful contract with Canal+ Successful contract with SociÃ©tÃ© gÃ©nÃ©rale Corporate and Investment Banking Successful trainings for more than 50 employees in many fields (Agile, SOA, Java SE/EE, Docker, …) Partnership with Oracle, for sponsoring NetBeans Day France I’m a Java EE developer, I believe and love the Continuous Integration and the Continuous Delivery, this lead me to seek theÂ Continuous Challenge & Learning.
